ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Fruits of every kind, and they will be honoured
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: a variety of delicious fruits; and they shall be honoured
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and fruits while they are honored.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Fruits; and they will be honoured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Fruits; and they shall be honored,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Fruits, and they shall be highly honored,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Fruits. And they will be honoured
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: fruits of various kinds; and they shall be honoured,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Fruits! And they shall be honoured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —fruits—and they will be held in honour,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Fruits (Delights); and they (shall enjoy) honour and dignity,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Fruits; and they shall be honoured,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: fruits. And they are receivers of generosity
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Fruits; and they will be honored.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Fruits; and they will be honored
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:42] fruits (fawākihu either substitutes for rizqun, or is an explication thereof) here these [fruits] represent what   is eaten for delight and not for the sake of preserving one’s health [as in this world], for the inhabitants of Paradise are in no need of preserving it given that their bodies will be created to be everlasting — and they will honoured, with God’s reward, glory be to Him, exalted be He,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Fruits) they have different kinds of fruit. (And they will be honoured) with gifts
